Description: Arquitecture of the nucleic acid (indicates how strand are grouped)
Single Strand (nothing but local structures, no base pairing)
Complex Protein Nucl. Acid (protein Included in the simulation)
Original helical conformation of the Nucleic Acids
Local features found in structure (esp. RNA)
Kink Turn (k-turn) A tight turn ina helix
Bulges (unpaired extra base in a helix)
Internal Loops (unpaired regions in a helix)
Kissing Loops (Two loops pairing outside of respective stems)
Internal ribosome entry site (IRES) RNA domain
Counter ions to compensate NA charge
Charmm TIP 3-point with LJ on H's
Type of trajectory related to conformation changes
Equilibrium (thermal fluctuations without major conf. Changes)
Analysis: any data derived from trajectories (simulated or experimental ensembles)
Analysis made on a single snapshot
Analysis done on a single residue (base)
Analysis done on a group of residues
Analysis done on a base pair (considering the main NA pairing)
Analysis done on a base pair step (2 consequent base pairs, considering the main pairing)
Analysis done on other sequence fragments
Analysis done on the complete system
Analysis done on a group of trajectories
Analysis done on a experimental structure
Translational Base Pair Step Helical parameters
Rotational Base Pair Step Helical parameters
Matrix of stiffness constants (twist, roll, tilt, rise, shift, slide)
Video of Trajectory in standard formats
Number of PCA EigenValues for a given variance
